message: Another in a long list of reasons to never shop at giant eagle. This evil bunch of fox chapel liberals will stop at nothing to quash competition and keep lining their back pockets. Isn't it funny how they opened Good Sense stores near Bottom Dollar stores and immediately closed them all when Bottom Dollar went out of business...? They made monopolized the Pgh grocery market by cutting Krogers, A&Ps and Foodlands throats with really low prices and now the that their competition is all gone, they've raised their prices to the roof! And you people who think that ge's fuel perks are a good deal need to buy some swampland in Fla. But, they are buddies with the the local and state leftist politicians, so their legally questionable business tactics will never be scrutinized... >>NEVER BUY AT GIANT TURD-BIRD STORES<<
Mohsin Rasheed

I'm not as avid a gamer as some, but I've found that some games are stunning in their creativity and content. Check out """"The Unfinished Swan"""". The music is beautiful, the game play is different, and the story is rather simple and poignant. I think video games are mediums that blend visuals, sounds, etc together in an attempt to tell a story. Imo, that is art: telling a story. Does that mean Call of Duty is art? Well, that's subjective, correct?
But when the guardsil causes seizure's its nbd and we should consider that a """"normal reaction"""" bullshit.

And yet no one cares. They've been playing this song since the Bush admin. Step one: place quote by anonymous source in paper of record (ie Wall St Journal). Step two: quote said paper of record (the Wall St Journal said today...) but leave out the context, turning anon source into quotable fact. Step three: repeat quickly and often. Step four: marginalize and ignore your critics. Your move, Media Matters.
